programme.desc: A single mother is swept into a dark underworld while her son discovers an underwater town.

programme.title: This Means War
programme.desc: Once inseparable pals and partners, two CIA agents (Chris Pine, Tom Hardy) turn their deadly skills and an array of high-tech gadgetry against each other after both fall for the same woman (Reese Witherspoon).

programme.title: Cleaner
programme.desc: Radical activists take 300 hostages at an energy company's annual gala in a high-rise building. It's now up to a former soldier who works as a window cleaner to save the hostages trapped inside, including her younger brother.

programme.title: Get Out
programme.desc: A young photographer uncovers a dark secret when he meets his girlfriend's seemingly friendly parents for the first time at their posh estate.

programme.title: Annabelle
programme.desc: Members of a satanic cult invade the home of a man (Ward Horton) and his pregnant wife (Annabelle Wallis) and turn a vintage doll into a conduit for ultimate evil.

programme.title: Annabelle: Creation
programme.desc: Years after the tragic death of their daughter, a former toy maker and his wife welcome a nun and six orphaned girls into their farmhouse. Terror soon strikes when one child finds a seemingly innocent doll that appears to have a life of its own.

programme.title: Annabelle Comes Home
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren keep a possessed doll locked up in an artifacts room in their house. When the doll awakens the room's evil spirits, it soon becomes a night of terror for the couple's young daughter and her friends.

programme.title: Evil Dead Rise
programme.desc: A reunion between two estranged sisters gets cut short by the rise of flesh-possessing demons, thrusting them into a primal battle for survival as they face the most nightmarish version of family imaginable.

programme.title: The Whale
programme.desc: A reclusive English teacher, living alone in the wake of a tragedy, attempts to reconnect with his teenage daughter for one last chance at redemption.

programme.title: The Silence of the Lambs
programme.desc: An FBI trainee (Jodie Foster) seeks advice from a brilliant, psychopathic prisoner (Anthony Hopkins) to catch a killer who skins his victims.

programme.title: Hannibal
programme.desc: Seven years have passed since Dr. Hannibal Lecter (Anthony Hopkins) escaped from custody. The doctor is now at large in Europe. Mason Verger (Gary Oldman) remembers Lecter too, and is obsessed with revenge.

programme.title: What's Your Number?
programme.desc: A pessimistic magazine article prompts an unmarried woman to revisit her numerous ex-boyfriends to find out if one of them could be her true love.

programme.title: Climax
programme.desc: When members of a dance troupe are lured to an empty school, drug-laced sangria causes their jubilant rehearsal to descend into a dark and explosive nightmare as they try to survive the night -- and find out who's responsible -- before it's too late.

programme.title: Cunningham
programme.desc: The artistic evolution of Merce Cunningham -- from his early years as a struggling dancer in postwar New York to his emergence as one of the world's most visionary choreographers.

programme.title: Insidious
programme.desc: A family looks to prevent evil spirits from trapping their comatose child in a realm called The Further.

programme.title: Pride & Prejudice
programme.desc: A convoluted courtship begins between a young woman (Keira Knightley) and the handsome friend (Matthew Macfadyen) of a wealthy bachelor.

programme.title: In the Fade
programme.desc: Katja's life falls apart in the blink of an eye when two neo-Nazis kill her husband and 6-year-old son in a bomb attack. Her quest for justice soon pushes her to the edge as the two suspects stand trial for murder.

programme.title: Justice League
programme.desc: Fueled by his restored faith in humanity and inspired by Superman's selfless act, Batman and his new ally Wonder Woman recruit Aquaman, Cyborg and the Flash to help them save the planet from a newly awakened enemy.

programme.title: Lost River
programme.desc: A single mother is swept into a dark underworld while her son discovers an underwater town.

programme.title: Evil Dead Rise
programme.desc: A reunion between two estranged sisters gets cut short by the rise of flesh-possessing demons, thrusting them into a primal battle for survival as they face the most nightmarish version of family imaginable.

programme.title: Public Enemies
programme.desc: Depression-era outlaw John Dillinger (Johnny Depp) becomes the fledgling FBI's most-wanted criminal and a folk hero to much of America's downtrodden public.

programme.title: Trap
programme.desc: A man and his teenage daughter realize they're at the center of a dark and sinister event while watching a concert.

programme.title: Greenland
programme.desc: A family embarks on a perilous journey as a planet-killing comet hurtles toward Earth. As the countdown to the global apocalypse approaches zero, their incredible trek culminates in a desperate and last-minute flight to a possible safe haven.

programme.title: Mr. Nobody
programme.desc: In 2092, the last mortal human on Earth reflects on his long past and thinks about the lives he might have led.

programme.title: Suicide Squad
programme.desc: Deadshot (Will Smith), Harley Quinn (Margot Robbie), Captain Boomerang, Killer Croc and other armed supervillains unite to battle a mysterious and powerful entity, while the diabolical Joker (Jared Leto) launches an evil agenda of his own.

programme.title: The Suicide Squad
programme.desc: The government sends the most dangerous supervillains in the world to the remote, enemy-infused island of Corto Maltese. Armed with high-tech weapons, they trek through the dangerous jungle on a search-and-destroy mission with Col. Rick Flag.

programme.title: Wonder Woman
programme.desc: After leaving her all-female island for the first time, Wonder Woman (Gal Gadot) discovers her full powers and true destiny while fighting alongside men in a war to end all wars.

programme.title: Wonder Woman 1984
programme.desc: Wonder Woman musters all of her strength, wisdom and courage as she finds herself squaring off against Maxwell Lord and the Cheetah, a villainess who possesses superhuman strength and agility.

programme.title: Dune
programme.desc: Paul Atreides, a brilliant and gifted young man born into a great destiny beyond his understanding, must travel to the most dangerous planet in the universe to ensure the future of his family and his people.

programme.title: Dune: Part Two
programme.desc: Paul Atreides unites with Chani and the Fremen while seeking revenge against the conspirators who destroyed his family. Facing a choice between the love of his life and the fate of the universe, he must prevent a terrible future only he can foresee.

programme.title: Fight Club
programme.desc: Two young professionals (Brad Pitt, Edward Norton) create an underground club where men can compete in hand-to-hand combat.

programme.title: Aquaman
programme.desc: Aquaman must retrieve the legendary Trident of Atlan to save the underwater city of Atlantis -- and the surface world -- from his power-hungry brother.

programme.title: Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom
programme.desc: Black Manta wields the power of the mythic Black Trident to unleash an ancient and malevolent force. Hoping to end his reign of terror, Aquaman forges an unlikely alliance with his brother to protect their kingdom and save the world from destruction.

programme.title: Mountainhead
programme.desc: Four friends reunite during worldwide economic turmoil.
